intro: Styphelia biflora, commonly known as the two-flowered heath, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is typically found in acidic, well-drained soils. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It has a low-growing, mat-forming habit with evergreen foliage. Styphelia biflora is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
